DOC.brief_summary: Evaluate the efficacy of ketorolac 0.5%, a topical non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID), to prevent macular edema after epiretinal membrane surgery. Patients undergoing epiretinal membrane surgery have increased risk of macular swelling which can adversely affect vision. Since post-intraocular surgery inflammation is a contributing factor to macular swelling and loss of vision, NSAID drops may be able to prevent or minimize the deleterious effects of macular swelling after epiretinal membrane surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Prophylactic Ketorolac Post Epiretinal Membrane Surgery
